result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel L Smith

records.addlTxt: copy for Samuel L. Smith for the December 1, 2022 competency hearing.
Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.
Competency hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10-11 Emailed Atty Welch amended bond form for DE to sign.
10-14 emailed the amended form to Atty Welch

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RD.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant is permitted to be on the 4000 block of Nakoosa Trail in Madison but he shall not be in apartment 103.

Defendant Samuel L Smith in court. Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Samuel L Smith.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Welch raises competency. Atty Welch argued to modify bond, no objection by the state. Court grants motion to modify bond. DE may return to apartment complex and may be in the 4000 block of Nakoosa Trail, but is banned from apartment 103. All other bond conditions remain the same. DE is ordered to have out-patient competency exam.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RD.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be on the 4000 block of Nakoosa Trail in Madison.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

2:31 PM Defendant Samuel L. Smith in court in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Samuel L. Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
